verbose_text: In this report, we demonstrate that knocking down various Drosophila Activin signaling components either in the whole body or in adult muscle tends to shorten the mean life span of adult flies, while over-expression of either a wild-type Daw gene or a wild-type Myo gene (but not a wild-type Actbeta gene) in adult skeletal muscle extends the overall mean adult lifespan.
evidence: over-expression of either a wild-type Daw gene or a wild-type Myo gene
